saberes: Self-confidence in the use of a foreign language.
Introduction to the basic strategies of common use for the comprehension and production of brief, simple and contextualized oral, written and multimodal texts.

Basic communicative functions of common use appropriate to the field and context: greet, say goodbye, introduce and introduce yourself; identify the characteristics of people, objects and places; answer specific questions about everyday issues; express time, quantity and space.
Basic contextual models of common use in the comprehension and production of short and simple oral, written and multimodal texts, such as congratulations, notes, lists or notices.

Basic linguistic units in common use and meanings associated with said structures, such as expression of the entity and its properties, quantity and number, affirmation, exclamation, negation, interrogation.
Elementary vocabulary of interest to students related to basic close interpersonal relationships, housing, places and nearby environments.
Initiation in basic sound and accentual patterns of common use.
Introduction to basic spelling conventions in common use.
Basic conversational conventions and strategies in common use, in synchronous or asynchronous format, to initiate, maintain and end communication, take and give the floor, ask and answer, etc.
Basic analogue and digital tools in common use for oral, written and multimodal comprehension and production.

Elementary strategies and techniques for detecting communicative deficiencies and limitations derived from the level of competence in the foreign language and in the other languages of the own linguistic repertoire.

Initiation to the basic strategies of common use to identify and use linguistic units (lexicon, morphosyntax, sound patterns, etc.) from the comparison of the languages and varieties that make up the personal linguistic repertoire.
The foreign language as a means of communication and relationship with people from other countries.
Elementary and most significant sociocultural and sociolinguistic aspects related to customs and daily life in countries where the foreign language is spoken.
Initiation in the basic strategies of common use to respect and appreciate linguistic, cultural and artistic diversity, based on ecosocial and democratic values.
Introduction to basic strategies for detecting discriminatory uses of verbal and non-verbal language.
criteriosEvaluacion: 1.1. Recognize and interpret common words and expressions in brief and simple oral, written and multimodal texts on frequent and daily topics of personal relevance and close to their experience, expressed in an understandable, clear, simple and direct way, and in standard language.

1.2. Select and apply elementary comprehension strategies in a guided way with the help of linguistic and non-linguistic elements of the context and cotext in daily communicative situations and relevant to the students in order to capture the global idea and identify specific elements.

2.1. Orally express short and simple sentences with basic information about everyday matters and relevant to the students, using verbal and non-verbal resources in a guided way, resorting to models and structures previously presented and paying attention to rhythm, stress and intonation .

2.2. Write words, well-known expressions and phrases based on models and with a specific purpose, through analog and digital tools, using vocabulary and elementary structures on everyday matters, of personal relevance to the students and close to their experience.

2.3. Select and apply, in a guided way, basic strategies to produce brief and simple messages appropriate to the communicative intentions using, with help, resources and physical or digital supports depending on the needs of each moment.

3.1. Participate, in a guided way, in elementary interactive situations on daily topics, previously prepared, through various supports, relying on resources such as repetition, slow rhythm or non-verbal language, and showing empathy.

3.2. Select and use, in a guided way and in close environments, elementary strategies for greeting, saying goodbye and introducing oneself; expressing simple and brief messages; and formulating and answering basic questions for communication.

4.1. Interpret and explain basic information on concepts, communications and short and simple texts, in a guided way, in situations in which to attend to diversity, showing empathy and interest in the interlocutors and in understanding problems in their immediate environment, relying on various resources and supports.
5.1. Compare and contrast similarities and obvious differences between different languages, reflecting, in a guided way, on basic aspects of how they work.

5.2. Identify and apply, in a guided way, knowledge and strategies to improve their ability to communicate and learn the foreign language, with the support of other participants and analog and digital supports.
5.3. Identify and explain, in a guided way, elementary progress and difficulties in the foreign language learning process.
6.1. Show interest in intercultural communication, identifying and analyzing, in a guided way, the most common discriminations, prejudices and stereotypes, in everyday and habitual situations.
6.2. Recognize and appreciate the linguistic and cultural diversity related to the foreign language, showing interest in knowing its elementary cultural and linguistic elements.
